questiontext.text:
Consider the right angle triangle in the Truss problem as shown above,where &theta = 68o and &phi = 22o, and the force applied on the truss system is 75 N.

Using the method of joints, calculate a) The reaction forces and b) the forces on each member.

(Give your answer to the nearest whole number.)

RA = {1:NUMERICAL:= 64:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

RC= {1:NUMERICAL:= 11:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

FAB = {1:NUMERICAL:=-70:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

FBC = {1:NUMERICAL:=-28:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

FAC = {1:NUMERICAL:= 26:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

c)from the drop down list below indicate for each member if it is in tension or compression

FAB {1:MULTICHOICE:~Tension ~=Compression}

FBC {1:MULTICHOICE:~Tension ~=Compression}

FAC {1:MULTICHOICE:~Compression ~=Tension}

generalfeedback.text:
Use the diagram above to help solve this problem.

Consider the whole truss as a single beam.

Find the reaction forces by taking moments about A and B.

Consider each vertices seperately to find the forces on each member and assume all elements are in tension.

Finally, positive force means the element is in tension, otherwise compression.
